questions.question: She wants to …………………………. her emotions.
questions.description: To give vent to your emotions is to express them freely.

questions.question: I can never …………………………. indiscipline.
questions.description: To put up with is to tolerate.

questions.question: A committee was …………………………….. to look into the matter.
questions.description: To set up is to establish.

questions.question: The old man ……………………………… after a prolonged illness.
questions.description: To pass away is to die.

questions.question: The workers’ association has decided to ………………………………….. the meeting to a later date.
questions.description: To put off is to postpone.

questions.question: The doctor advised the patient to ……………………………….. smoking.
questions.description: To give up smoking is to quit smoking.

questions.question: They fought bravely but in the end they had to …………………………….
questions.description: To give in is to yield or surrender.

questions.question: She ………………………………. her old mother with great love and patience.
questions.description: To take care of is to look after or nurse.

questions.question: The charges of corruption ………………………………. the downfall of the government.
questions.description: To bring about is to cause.

questions.question: He had to ……………………………… a lot of obstacles.
questions.description: To get around is to overcome.

questions.question: The President’s plane ……………………………… exactly at 4 pm.
She was not …………………………….. by his nice words.
questions.description: When you are taken in, you are deceived.
